txt.en: Instance: The Fate of Laerdan
'Welcome, father.'
'Your Narmeleth is gone, a phantom devised for your ensnarement.'
'Father... where are you?'
'Father, come quickly!'
'But come, father. Will you not give up the burden that you bear?'
'Where are you father? Why do you not come?'
'So be it. My men will recover Narchuil from you.'
Laerdan searches even now for his beloved daughter Narmeleth, seeking to bring her the shards of Narchuil and restore her mind.
'The darkness is all about me.... Father, where are you?'
'All that you have known will be turned to ruin.'
'I am cured.... Why will no one come to me? Father, I am scared.'
'Take him alive... he may still be of some use to us....'
Laerdan has been tricked. He must defend himself against the onslaught of Amarthiel, Champion of Angmar....
'And just where do you think you are going?'
'Prisoners always please Sharkû!'
'What kind of Elf trickery is this!?'
'I will deal with this golug myself!'
Find Narmeleth
Survive Amarthiel's onslaught
Survive Amarthiel's onslaught
Elrond is concerned as to the plight of Laerdan at Tham Mírdain....
A voice cries out, 'Father, where are you?'
A voice wails, 'Father I am cured. Will you not come to me...?'
A voice wails, 'Father, I am scared... will no one help me?'
asdf
